urls.title: The River Lea is plagued by pollution ‚Äì it is no place for a swim | Letters
urls.description: Letters: Readers respond to a photo essay on bathers in the River Lea at Hackney Marshes in east London

tweets.text:
"We do know that local volunteers are pulling sanitary waste out of the river just upstream of 'Hackney Beach'." The reality of England's rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/rdKF8KpJFu

@RossCherrington @bettwsresident @EnvAgencySW @SoilsAlliance Agreed it rains a lot anyway.  Named storms in the context of this video that‚Äôs all. üëç.  Just interested to know where the line is drawn in the sand with force majeureüòè.
@rsmithsoil @bettwsresident @EnvAgencySW @SoilsAlliance Not sure named storms takes away from the fact it rains a lot anyway

Latest from #Lewes - plant machinery is being used to help us tackle the fire involving 250 tonnes of scrap metal. We're making good progress.  Great work by our partners, @ESFRS_Control and crews on the ground. @EnvAgencySE @sussex_police @SECAmbulance https://t.co/tpX8na7LaH

If @WaterUK  wants to see the harm of storm overflows removed what does it think of the industry ignoring the @EnvAgency requirement to classify and rectify its 'storm' failures way back in 2018? Would be sorted by now. Serious question @RachSalv https://t.co/BSpna7G0e3

tweets.text:
@RossCherrington @bettwsresident @EnvAgencySW @SoilsAlliance This is what is normally done with the growers I work with.

Harvesting swedes on the left, and chisel ploughed on the right, even in less than ideal conditions. It can work, but not if it rains every day. Of course this is a temporary fix, that needs sorting when it dries out. https://t.co/dpjYBNBhaM
@RossCherrington @EnvAgencySW @SoilsAlliance Field choice is the single most important factor. High risk crop on high risk field = huge soil loss.

urls.title: Director jailed for illegal waste dumping at quarry | Construction News
urls.description: A director who allowed thousands of tonnes of waste to be illegally deposited in a former quarry has been jailed for more than two years. Mark Foley, 63,

tweets.text: Director jailed for illegal waste dumping at quarry- around half of the waste was found to be carcinogenic or harmful to the environment.  https://t.co/i8O1x0VMwD
The #RiverVer is one of only 200 or so #chalkstreams in the world and enjoying a rare good year. And somebody thinks it's OK to turn it yellow! @EnvAgencySE informed. https://t.co/JW3CbL4mK0

tweets.text:
Read the latest update about #WalleysQuarry here üëâ  https://t.co/o558iAVicn
 
We're on site today reviewing the waste @RedIndustries2 has been accepting from yesterday.
 
It's to complete capping of parts of the landfill - work required by the enforcement notice we issued. https://t.co/cWCjwzcYSF

@bettwsresident @EnvAgencySW @SoilsAlliance There could be mitigation methods employed,  but these normally aren't considered by the grower and a lot of these fields are sub let  on a short term agreement

The #BostonBarrier is one of more than 700 @EnvAgency schemes which have contributed to better protecting 300,000 homes from flooding over the last 6 years.
